titleproper.value: Guide to the Krishna Reddy Papers <num>MC.244</num>

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2019-09-20T17:43:01</date>

extent.value: in 6 record cartons, 4 flat boxes, 5 manuscript boxes, 1 folder in a shared manuscript box, and 2 folders in a shared oversize box.

abstract.value: The Krishna Reddy Papers were created in conjunction with the life and career of Krishna Reddy, a longtime professor of art at New York University. Most of the collection's materials reflect Reddy's work as a teacher or as a printmaker, and include solo and group exhibition catalogs, as well as programs, promotional materials, and audiovisual footage of workshops. Some materials are of a documentary nature, and include transcribed and taped interviews with Reddy, newspaper articles, and a hardcover book on his career. The collection also contains two hardcover books written by Reddy on printmaking methods.

p.value: Administrative records and unpublished reports of New York University are closed for a period of 20 years from the date of their creation. Access to files spanning multiple years will be opened to researchers based on the date of the most recent materials. Board of Trustees records are closed for 35 years from the date of creation. Materials related to personnel, grievances, job and fellowship searches and applications, and all files that fall under the federal Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act (FERPA) are permanently restricted. Additional restrictions may apply to other materials in this collection. For questions regarding specific restrictions, please contact the University Archives.
Identification of item, date (if known); Krishna Reddy Papers; MC 244; box number; folder number; New York University Archives

The Krishna Reddy Papers were donated to the New York University Archives by Krishna and Judy Blum Reddy in 2014, with an additional donation by Judith Blum Reddy in 2019. The accession numbers associated with these gifts are 14.014 and 2019.039.
Reddy was named Professor Emeritus at NYU in 2001. Krishna Reddy died in 2018.

The collection also contains a few published volumes authored by Reddy that detail his printmaking innovations. One hardcover book, <emph render="italic">Krishna's Cosmos</emph>, covers Reddy's career from a biographical perspective.

dsc.value:
Series I: Correspondence2461761945-2008Scope and content

This series contains correspondence written to Reddy, primarily from art scholars and exhibitors. Personal correspondence is also included.

This series contains materials relating to the solo and group exhibitions in which Reddy showed his art. Programs, promotional materials, and catalogs, including bound volumes, are included.

This series includes news clippings, interview transcriptions, and biographical articles and books written about Reddy. Among the books is "Krishna's Cosmos," a 2003 photographic biography of Reddy.

This series contains manuscripts and published volumes written by Reddy, as well as programs and promotional materials for his printmaking workshops. Also included are academic works by graduate students Reddy advised at NYU.

This series contains personal photographs, as well as images depicting Krishna Reddy's artistic career over time. Images in Series V include art prints of Reddy's drawings and photographic prints of his sculptures, as well as images of works by his artistic precursors and mentors, including Joan Miro, Ossip Zadkine, Rabindranath Tagore, and Heinz Leinfellner. Also depicted in the series are scenes from printmaking workshops and Reddy's 1972 receipt of the Padma Shri award. Many images of Reddy's own works contain detailed explanations of artistic technique on their reverse sides.

Rabelais2461981959-1965612Self-portraits2462271950-197072St. Margarethan Symposium, Austria246199196173Tobie Steinhouse and Krishna Reddy2462251989 November74Trinity College Exhibition--Opening Reception246192circa 1980s75Workshops and teaching activities2462321970-circa 1990s76Workshops, teaching, personal photographs246195circa 1960s-1990s77Workshops, teaching, sculpture246229circa 1960s-1980s78Zadkine's Atelier246193195279Zadkine's Atelier--Sculptures (1 of 3)246194circa 1950s710Zadkine's Atelier--Sculptures (2 of 3)246226circa 1950s711Zadkine's Atelier--Sculptures (3 of 3)246197circa 1950s712Series VI: Audiovisual Materials246181undated, 1980-1993Scope and content

This series contains audio and audiovisual materials. Audiovisual formats include U-matic, DVD, VHS (some NTSC), and 1/4" audio. Video recordings include interviews with Reddy, as well as footage of his printmaking workshops and artistic process. Four audio tapes also consist of an interview.
